description: Hailey-Hailey Disease, also known as familial benign pemphigus, is a rare genetic skin disorder characterized by the formation of blisters and erosions in areas of friction and skin folds. It is caused by mutations in the ATP2C1 gene, which leads to a dysfunction in calcium transport within cells.
possible causes: Genetic mutations in the ATP2C1 gene
symptoms: Blisters and erosions in skin folds
Redness and irritation in affected areas
